titles.title: A bill to amend title 3, United States Code, to require reimbursement for employees detailed to the White House Office and certain other offices for the full period of time for which any such employees are so detailed, rather than for only periods in excess of 180 calendar days in any fiscal year.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 8/2/1988--Introduced. Requires reimbursement for Federal employees detailed to the White House Office, the Executive Residence at the White House, the Office of the Vice President, the Domestic Policy Staff, and the Office of Administration for the time such employees are so detailed. (Current provisions of law require such reimbursement for periods of details in excess of 180 calendar days.)
